intro: Cytisus ruthenicus, commonly known as the Russian broom, is a shrub native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features slender, arching branches with small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has compound leaves composed of several oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it adaptable to various garden conditions. Cytisus ruthenicus is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to stabilize soil in erosion-prone areas.
